intro: Mirbelia speciosa subsp. speciosa, commonly known as the showy mirbelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring compound leaves and yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is also threatened by habitat loss and land clearing.
